metadata.title: CVE-2022-31085 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: LDAP Account Manager (LAM) is a webfrontend for managing entries (e.g.users, groups, DHCP settings) stored in an LDAP directory. In versionsprior to 8.0 the session files include the LDAP user name and password inclear text if the PHP OpenSSL extension is not installed or encryption isdisabled by configuration. This issue has been fixed in version 8.0. Usersunable to upgrade should install the PHP OpenSSL extension and make suresession encryption is enabled in LAM main configuration.

criterions.comment: ldap-account-manager: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
